explanations.machine learning: The paper discusses the use of Self-Organizing Maps (SOM), a type of machine learning algorithm, for feature clustering in financial time-series data.
explanations.unsupervised learning: Self-Organizing Maps (SOM) are a type of unsupervised learning algorithm, which is used in the paper for clustering features without labeled data.
explanations.clustering: The paper focuses on feature clustering using SOM and hierarchical clustering methods to group similar features in financial time-series data.
explanations.neural network: The paper explicitly mentions the use of neural networks, specifically Self-Organizing Maps (SOM), for discovering nonlinear relationships in input data.
explanations.feature learning: The paper proposes a method for feature clustering, which involves learning and grouping features from financial time-series data.
explanations.feature representation: The paper utilizes the visualization capabilities of SOM, such as Component Planes, to represent and analyze features in the data.
